intro: Cynoglossum nebrodense var. pustulatum, commonly known as the Italian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is often found in mountainous regions. It has hairy leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. This variety is distinguished by its pustules on the leaves, which give it its specific epithet.
